snippet: The claim, if confirmed, would be the first time during a two-year jihadist insurgency that extremists in Egypt had taken captive and killed a foreigner.
abstract: Sinai Province, Islamic State affiliate in Egypt, claims to have beheaded Croatian hostage Tomislav Salopek, who was kidnapped in July 2015 near Cairo; if confirmed, barbaric act would mark fearsome shift in insurgency that had been largely aimed at military and police forces.

byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick contributed reporting from London, Merna Thomas from Cairo, and Joseph Orovic from Zadar, Croatia.

lead_paragraph: The claim, if confirmed, would be the first time during a two-year jihadist insurgency that extremists in Egypt had taken captive and killed a foreigner.

headline.main: ISIS Affiliate in Egypt Says It Has Beheaded Croatian Prisoner
headline.print_headline: ISIS Affiliate in Egypt Says It Has Beheaded Croatian Hostage

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Sinai Province of the Islamic State

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
